description: This should be an unpaid part of the service to encourage adoption of ProtonMail and email encryption.
Only thing i recommend is please just continue development for flatpak as it is universal to all linux OS's and would make development cheaper for you guys.
Protonmail bridge works excellently for me. It even supports storing it's credentials in zx2c4's pass.
Very simple and straightforward. Saves me having to install a separate app just to access my PM email.
Great app that allow me continue use my usual approach with standalone client. Works as expected

description:
Starting April 23rd, 2020, every app you use to access your ProtonMail inbox is open source and has passed an independent security audit.
https://protonmail.com/blog/android-open-source/
summary: Fully open source. The license Tag is now WRONG

description: Easy to setup. Works very well. Is provided also on Arch AUR and Flatpak.
easy to setup with custom domains

Brilliant set up, straightforward to use, similar to anything good you used for mail before. Great migration system from folders in old mail companies (2 in my case) to new and address books too, so no drama, sweat or tears moving over. It took 10 - 15 minutes on a so-so connection?
Everything I tried to do over the last month has been straight forward too.
If I have any niggles the folder box is too small and only displays about 5 folders and I have 50+. The 'send to folder' menu seems to remember the last folder rather than being blank. That is it and I can be fussy!
I always used free and accepted minimal ads as part of the deal - here there is nothing and my minimal payment scheme gives me 5gb data storage - more than I used on google in 20 years - and in days of governments not liking what underwear you use, it is nice to know it is about as secure as it should be.
summary: Way to go in modern times?

description: encrypted email from 3 letters agency

Now I can close my pinned beta.protonmail.com tab 
GREAT WORK DEVS. If someone is voting low stars they either 1) do not know what they want; therefore this package does not do what they THINK it should do or 2) cannot read the instructions readily available at https://protonmail.com/bridge/install
Proton makes some good products. Couldn't get any easier on Ubuntu. Great job Swiss peeps!

I love ProtonMail, and I'me glad that they produced this. 

I just wish that it can be made so that I could use it on other email apps besides Thunderbird.
summary: Nice to bring together with other email

description: Does as it is intended. I only wish there was a way for it to launch minimized in the taskbar. I dont feel its necessary for it to launch fullscreen everytime I start the service considering its 99.9% of the time a background service for thunderbird
Works great with both Thunderbird and Evolution.

Gets me access to my encrypted email so that's a plus.

Some mail clients don't like connecting to servers when the SSL certificate can't be verified. Some of those will display an error with an option to trust anyway. For those that don't do that, you have to add the SSL certificate that the bridge generates to your system trust store.

For people users not wanting to care about PGP in details, ProtonMail allows you to just do that. Some recipients will require you to upload their PGP public key via the ProtonMail webmail, but that's the only thing. For other recipients with WKD key distribution enabled, this is even more transparent. After this, sending and receiving mails goes PGP encrypted automatically.

With ProtonMail Bridge app, you still don't need to think about PGP. The Bridge does that magic for you. Just connect your IMAP/SMTP mail client to the Bridge and you're done.

This Bridge does have some quirks with Thunderbird (labels and "All Mails" folder are cumbersome and can confuse Thunderbird a lot). If you are an advanced PGP user, using externally managed PGP private keys can also be tedious and not always working as expected. But this Bridge does improve for each update.
summary: Works great with paid ProtonMail plans
